DOC.brief_summary: Case-control study evaluate gait parameter different condition patient suffer chronic ankle instability healthy individual .
DOC.brief_title: The Influence Dual Task Gait Speed Gait Variability Patients With Chronic Ankle Instability
DOC.detailed_description: This case-control study compare different gait parameter stride time stride length variability different gait condition ( e.g. , normal speed , normal speed dual task , fast speed fast speed dual task ) healthy individual patient suffer chronic ankle instability . measurement collect use OPTOGait system instal treadmill .
DOC.criteria: history least one significant ankle sprain occur least 12 month prior enrolment study diagnose physician physical therapist use clinical examination classification describe Malliaropoulos et al history least two episode 'giving way ' , feeling ankle joint instability previously injure ankle joint 1 year postinitial sprain recent injury occur 6 week prior study enrolment ability apply full weight bearing injure low extremity mild discomfort evidence concomitant injury ( bony injury significant muscular/tendon injury ) previous ankle surgery pathological condition surgical procedure low extremity neurological/vestibular balance disorder . The control group include healthy participant current previous condition could affect proprioception .
